Package ooga.model.game_components.move_types

Class PieceMovement

java.lang.Object
ooga.model.game_components.move_types.PieceMovement
Direct Known Subclasses:
FiniteJump, FiniteSlide, InfiniteJump, InfiniteSlide
public abstract class PieceMovement
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to represent a singular move that a piece can do. It needs the board, as well as sets of opponent/friendly pieces in order to determine whether moves are valid

  • Constructor Details

    • PieceMovement

      public PieceMovement​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> parameters, int direction)
      The constructor takes the parameters of the move. This includes the change in position of the move, as well as the information about whether this move can take a piece
      Parameters:
      parameters - The map of parameters

  • Method Details

    • getAllPossibleMoves

      public abstract java.util.List<Coordinate> getAllPossibleMoves​(Coordinate coordinates, GameBoard board, java.lang.String pieceTeam)
      Can be called on subclasses to determine the possible moves using the methods in this class. This must be implemented differently for each subclass so therefore it is abstract
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The coordinates of the piece that this move is acting on
      board - The board that this piece is on
      Returns:
      A list of all the coordinates of the possible move locations

    • setDummyBoard

      public void setDummyBoard​(GamePiece[][] board)

    • checkIfMoveInBounds

      protected boolean checkIfMoveInBounds​(Coordinate coordinates)
      Checks if a move is in bounds. The >= is due to the fact that the coordinate system starts at 0. So if we have an 8x8 board, the possible coordinates range from 0-7, making 8 out of bounds
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The coordinates of the piece
      Returns:
      A boolean representing if the move is in bounds or not

    • checkEnemyPieceLocationConditions

      protected boolean checkEnemyPieceLocationConditions​(Coordinate coordinates, java.lang.String teamName)
      Checks if a piece is in the take position, if this move type takes pieces. If there is, then we also need to see if the piece taken is where the piece lands, and if it isn't then we need to make sure that the piece landing spot is empty.
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The coordinates of the piece that this movement belongs to
      teamName - the name of the team that this piece corresponds to
      Returns:
      The boolean representing whether it has pieces to take

    • checkThatNoFriendlyPieceInMoveDestination

      protected boolean checkThatNoFriendlyPieceInMoveDestination​(Coordinate coordinates, java.lang.String teamName)
      Checks to make sure a friendly piece isn't in the location where the movement object is supposed to be going
      Parameters:
      coordinates - The starting coordinates of the piece
      teamName - The name of the team that the piece is on
      Returns:
      True if there is no piece in the landing location, false otherwise

    • checkIfFriendlyPieceInLocation

      private boolean checkIfFriendlyPieceInLocation​(int xPos, int yPos, java.lang.String teamName)

    • checkIfOpponentPieceInLocation

      private boolean checkIfOpponentPieceInLocation​(int xPos, int yPos, java.lang.String teamName)

    • checkIfPieceInSpace

      private boolean checkIfPieceInSpace​(int xPos, int yPos)

    • makeCoordinate

      protected Coordinate makeCoordinate​(int xPos, int yPos)
      Makes a coordinate object
      Parameters:
      xPos - The x position of the coordinate
      yPos - The y position of the coordinate
      Returns:
      The coordinate object

    • getChangeX

      protected int getChangeX()
      The change in x position of the piece for this move. Could be a finite change, or an infinite change, depending on the subclass that implements
      Returns:
      The change in x position

    • getChangeY

      protected int getChangeY()
      The change in y position of the piece for this move. Could be a finite change, or an infinite change, depending on the subclass that implements
      Returns:
      The change in y position

    • isMustTake

      protected boolean isMustTake()
      Tells whether this movement must take another piece when this movement object is executed
      Returns:
      True if this move must take another piece, false if not

    • getTakeX

      protected int getTakeX()
      If the piece corresponding to this object needs to be moved, it might need to take a piece. This method gives the x position oof the piece that needs to be taken relative to the final position of this piece
      Returns:
      The x position relative to the final position of the piece being moved

    • getTakeY

      protected int getTakeY()
      If the piece corresponding to this object needs to be moved, it might need to take a piece. This method gives the y position oof the piece that needs to be taken relative to the final position of this piece
      Returns:
      The y position relative to the final position of the piece being moved
